Some of these accounts are people that I know from years back on the unofficial Ripple forum.

I have a hard time articulating myself at times. I was trying to say that Rippleco is an awesome resource that haters would LOVE to prevent us from utilizing. Not engaging with @ Ripple solely because of what the haters might say, is what they want. Voluntary association FTW!
Ripple and XRP are, and have always been, separate things.

Thinking about this comment a little more... I don’t think community members should avoid seeking help from Ripple out of fear of being called names. That’s succumbing to the namecaller’s tactics. Also, keep in mind, there will never be just one group that represents XRP.

I have many Bitcoin wallets and XRP addresses. You can never know how many different accounts belong to just one person. But with @ Ripple, there is transparency. They make their holdings public knowledge. Personally, I don’t think other people’s finances are any of my business.
Ripple and XRP are, and have always been, separate.
The triskelion belongs to Rippleco (legally) and not XRP.

It seems like no matter what, we need @ Ripple’s help. They own the current logo. We’d have to ask them to gift it to the community. If we rebrand, it will take resources. Ripple has them, but the community does not.

While I can understand why @ Ripple wants to keep the triskelion for themselves, for better or worse, it’s the sole symbol associated with $ XRP. Rebranding will require serious resources and the community coffer is nonexistent. I nominate @rbrtbrgnjn to solve this problem. https://twitter.com/rbrtbrgnjn/status/994848267438579713 …
My mom knows about @ Ripple and @ bgarlinghouse and it’s not through me. I’m still dealing with the trauma of having my parents explain (their version of) Ripple to me.
$ XRP is a gateway crypto and those representing other cryptos would be wise to knock off the douchebaggery, IMHO.
Intelligence is very sexy, in both males and females. # RippleTeam
I haven’t met a Bitcoiner yet who doesn’t like poker.

I understand that part. What I don’t understand is why Ripple is taking away $XRP’s triskelion instead of employing their large team, complete with enormously funded war chest, to create something unique to Ripple. Maybe I am misunderstanding?

The confusion between Ripple and XRP has *always* been there. Rippleco has rebranded and pivoted and EVOLVED, but this space has a stunted vocabulary. We need more clarity from Rippleco right now, IMO.
What if it was Ripple themselves who used the triskelion the most to promote XRP? (I have no idea if this is a possibility. I’m only asking for conversational purposes.)
It would be interesting to see what the triskelion has been used to promote more: XRP or Ripple.

I’m late to the party, sorry! Many people don’t view $ XRP as a currency (does @ Ripple?). Are you telling us that we need to create a currency symbol or that we can no longer use the triskelion as $XRP’s logo or both? # xrpthestandardhttps://twitter.com/ripple/status/994669478452412416?s=21 …
